content.title: Distribution Of Tractor Unit Under CMSGUY
content.details: The 'Distribution of Tractor Unit' Scheme is a Component under the Umbrella Scheme of 'Chief Minister Samagra Gramya Unnayan Yojna (CMSGUY)' by the Govt. of Assam. CMSGUY is a village development scheme launched by Hon'ble Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal on 5th February 2017 in Guwahati. The scheme is being implemented in a mega mission mode in all villages of Assam. CMSGUY will be implemented through a saturation model by covering each revenue village through focused interventions in direct economic activities, logistic support including market linkages, and community support. The main objective of the 'Distribution of Tractor Unit' scheme is to revive the agricultural sector and help in doubling the farmer’s income by 2022. Under the new revised tractor scheme, the government will provide one tractor along with some necessary accessories in each revenue village at subsidized rates. The state govt. will distribute approx 10,109 tractors in the first phase. This tractor distribution scheme will cover all 26,000 villages of the entire state in a phase-wise manner. A group of 8-10 people who are actual adult farmers can apply to this scheme. The state govt. has allotted ₹ 1,000 Crore for the successful implementation of this scheme.
benefits: 70% subsidy will be provided to the selected groups on the price of the tractor, and its accessories including implements (as opted by the beneficiary group) subject to a maximum of ₹ 5,50,000.
The group will provide tractors to the farmers on a rental basis.
Each tractor unit shall consist of one tractor (35 to 50 HP) with standard accessories and Matching Implements.
eligibility: A group of 8-10 members who are the actual adult farmers of the same village.
The group should have a common bank account and will apply jointly with the signatures of each member on the application form preferably along with particulars of land and crops cultivated.
The applicant group should not have more than one member from one family.
exclusions: Individuals cannot apply to this scheme.
content.application_process: Offline. The applicant needs to get the application form from the District Agriculture Officer and fill in all the mandatory fields of the scheme application form in a prescribed format. The specified proofs are to be submitted along with the CMSGUY application form.
documents_required: Aadhar Card of all members of the Group
Residential Certificate of all members of the Group
Identity Card of all members of the Group
PAN Card of all members of the Group
Voter ID Cards of all members of the Group
Group’s Bank Account Passbook and Bank Statement
Power of Attorney for Authorized Signatory in the form of an Affidavit
Proof of Land Holding of all members of the Group
Caste Certificate (if applicable) of all members of the Group

faqs.question: What Is The Full Form Of CMSGUY?
faqs.answer: The full form of CMSGUY is 'Chief Minister Samagra Gramya Unnayan Yojna'.

faqs.question: Who Launched CMSGUY Scheme?
faqs.answer: CMSGUY is a village development scheme that was launched by Hon'ble Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal.

faqs.question: What Is The Scope Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is being implemented in a mega mission mode in all villages of Assam.

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of The 'Distribution Of Tractor Unit' Component Of CMSGUY?
faqs.answer: The main objective of the 'Distribution of Tractor Unit' scheme is to revive the agricultural sector and help in doubling the farmer’s income by 2022.

faqs.question: How Many Tractors Are Estimated For Distribution In The First Phase?
faqs.answer: The state govt. will distribute approx 10,109 tractors in the first phase.

faqs.question: How Many Funds Have Been Allotted By The State Government For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The state govt. has allotted ₹ 1,000 Crore for the successful implementation of this scheme.

faqs.question: Can An Individual Person Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only a group of 8-10 people who are actual adult farmers can apply to this scheme.

faqs.question: What Percentage Of The Subsidy Shall Be Provided By The Government?
faqs.answer: 70% subsidy will be provided to the selected groups on the price of the tractor, and its accessories including implements (as opted by the beneficiary group) subject to a maximum of ₹ 5,50,000.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Duration Of The Service?
faqs.answer: The group shall be liable to provide tractor units (fully or partially as per the need of the farmer) to the farmers of the village on a rental basis for a minimum period of five years at a reasonable rate which may be fixed by the District Level Committee (DLC).
